Author: nobodysaynothing
Text: So, I say this in the most supportive way possible: it isn't "challenging yourself" to eat cake when you plan to compensate by not eating other food. That's still ED thinking.  If you're patting yourself on the back for ED thinking, imagining that it's recovery thinking, then you might feel good for minute ... but you will continue to not recover.

Author: SemicolonButterfly
Text: I think perhaps there is an ember deep inside you - a fierceness of mind and body and spirit that has kept you tied to life and love through such great suffering. It is a bittersweet thing I sometimes think, that we should be so strong. What you wrote reminded me of a poem (“Since There is No Escape”) that I held on to in my darkest years...years when much of my conscious mind wanted to leave but some tiny mote of light deep inside me whispered, ‘stay’...’stay’...’stay’. Stay and live. Stay and love. Stay and find out what happens in the ‘after’ that you can’t currently imagine.   I myself possess no magic words and have no talisman to offer. But I can say in solidarity and in empathy that you are seen; that you are loved.
